resourceSpecs.help: This resource type represents MasterLink products
resourceSpecs.label: MasterLink product

MLN.help: MLN should be a unique number between 1 and 30 for identifying each product

address.help: "Video master" for the video master, "Audio master" for the audio master, "Distribution network" for the BeoMaster5, device id for other products

beo42010Enabled.help: Indicates whether the product is configured for Beo4-1710 navigation button compatibility

resourceSpecs.help: Control event
resourceSpecs.label: NetworkLink product

MLN.help: MLN should be a unique number between 1 and 30 for identifying each product

beo42010Enabled.help: Indicates whether the product is configured for Beo4-1710 navigation button compatibility

forcedAddress.help: If the product is in a non-standard network environment, you can set this field to the correct address (ip:port or host name) so the discovery, commands and state updates work properly

resourceSpecs.help: This resource type represents an airlink relay
resourceSpecs.label: Airlink Relay

resourceSpecs.help:
This resource type represents a KNX group address of type boolean (1 Bit).
 It is recommended to use Button, Toggle or GPIO instead.
 The group address C and T flags must be set in order to get feedback, and W flag must be set in order to control the device.
resourceSpecs.label: Boolean

resourceSpecs.help:
This resource type represents a KNX group address of type integer within [0..255].
 The group address C and T flags must be set in order to get feedback, and W flag must be set in order to control the device.
resourceSpecs.label: 1 Byte unsigned integer

resourceSpecs.help:
This resource type represents a KNX group address of type integer within [-128..127].
 The group address C and T flags must be set in order to get feedback, and W flag must be set in order to control the device.
resourceSpecs.label: 1 Byte signed integer

resourceSpecs.help:
This resource type represents a KNX group address of type integer within [0..65535].
 The group address C and T flags must be set in order to get feedback, and W flag must be set in order to control the device.
resourceSpecs.label: 2 Byte unsigned integer

resourceSpecs.help:
This resource type represents a KNX group address of type integer within [-32768..32767].
 The group address C and T flags must be set in order to get feedback, and W flag must be set in order to control the device.
resourceSpecs.label: 2 Byte signed integer

resourceSpecs.help:
This resource type represents a KNX group address of type integer within [0..15].
 The group address C and T flags must be set in order to get feedback, and W flag must be set in order to control the device.
resourceSpecs.label: 3 bit controlled

resourceSpecs.help:
Allows toggling a bit value and keeping its state.
 Requires C, T, R and W flags in order to work properly.
resourceSpecs.label: Toggle

address.help:
One group address or two valid group addresses separated by ':', each on the form [0..31]/[0..7]/[0..255] (e.g. 1/1/1), or [0..31]/[0..2047] (e.g. 1/1). 
In case of two group addresses, the first one is the GA mapped  to 'dimming' (write to KNX) and the second the one mapped to 'value' (read from KNX).

resourceSpecs.help:
KNX push button with PRESS/HOLD/RELEASE.
 Requires C, T and W flags in order to work properly.
resourceSpecs.label: Button

resourceSpecs.help:
Handles a dimmer without state.
 Requires C, T and W flags in order to work properly.
resourceSpecs.label: Dimmer without state

resourceSpecs.help:
Handles a dimmer with status.
The GA mapped to 'dimming' requires C, T and W flags and the GA mapped to 'value' requires C, T and R flags in order to work properly.
resourceSpecs.label: Dimmer

address.help:
Two valid group addresses separated by ':', each on the form [0..31]/[0..7]/[0..255] (e.g. 1/1/1), or [0..31]/[0..2047] (e.g. 1/1). 
The first one is the GA mapped  to 'dimming' (write to KNX) and the second the one mapped to 'value' (read from KNX).

resourceSpecs.help:
Allows handlging a bit value and keeping its state.
 Requires C, T, R and W flags in order to work properly.
resourceSpecs.label: GPIO

address.help:
One group address or two valid group addresses separated by ':', each on the form [0..31]/[0..7]/[0..255] (e.g. 1/1/1), or [0..31]/[0..2047] (e.g. 1/1). 
In case of two group addresses, the first one is the GA mapped  to 'dimming' (write to KNX) and the second the one mapped to 'value' (read from KNX).

resourceSpecs.help:
Handles a shade without state.
 The GA mapped to 'StopStep UpDown' and the GA mapped to 'Move UpDown' require C, T and W flags in order to work properly.
resourceSpecs.label: Shade without state

address.help:
Two valid group addresses separated by ':', each on the form [0..31]/[0..7]/[0..255] (e.g. 1/1/1), or [0..31]/[0..2047] (e.g. 1/1). 
The first one is the GA mapped  to the 'StopStep UpDown' group object (write to KNX) and the second is the GA mapped  to the 'Move UpDown' group object (write to KNX).

resourceSpecs.help:
Handles a shade with status.
The GA mapped to 'StopStep UpDown' and the GA mapped to 'Move UpDown' require C, T and W flags in order to work properly. The GA mapped to 'status' requires C, T and R flags in order to work properly.
resourceSpecs.label: Shade

address.help:
Three valid group addresses separated by ':', each on the form [0..31]/[0..7]/[0..255] (e.g. 1/1/1), or [0..31]/[0..2047] (e.g. 1/1). 
The first one is the GA mapped  to the 'StopStep UpDown' group object (write to KNX), the second is the GA mapped  to the 'Move UpDown' group object (write to KNX) and the third the one mapped to 'status' (read from KNX).

resourceSpecs.help:
Handles a thermostat with one setpoint.
The GA mapped to 'temperature' requires C, T and R flags and the GA mapped to 'setpoint' requires C, T, W and R flags in order to work properly.
resourceSpecs.label: Thermostat 1SP

address.help:
Two valid group addresses separated by ':', each on the form [0..31]/[0..7]/[0..255] (e.g. 1/1/1), or [0..31]/[0..2047] (e.g. 1/1). 
The first one is the GA mapped  to 'temperature' (read from KNX) and the second the one mapped to 'setpoint' (read/write from/to KNX).

resourceSpecs.help:
Handles a thermostat with one setpoint.
The GA mapped to 'temperature' requires C, T and R flags and the GA mapped to 'heat setpoint' and 'cool setpoint' requires C, T, W and R flags in order to work properly.
resourceSpecs.label: Thermostat 2SP

address.help:
Three valid group addresses separated by ':', each on the form [0..31]/[0..7]/[0..255] (e.g. 1/1/1), or [0..31]/[0..2047] (e.g. 1/1). 
The first one is the GA mapped  to 'temperature' (read from KNX) and the second one mapped to 'heat setpoint' (read/write from/to KNX), and the third one mapped to 'cool setpoint' (read/write from/to KNX)..

address.help:
Keypad button-> Processor(1-16):Link(4-6):Keypad(1-32):Button number(1-24)
RF Keypad button-> Processor(1-16):Link(8):Device type(2):Keypad(1-32):Button number(1-24)

RPM Dimmer/Switch-> Processor(1-16):Link(1):Router MI(0-15):Module(1-8):Output(1-4)
D48 Dimmer/Switch-> Processor(1-16):Link(4-6):Router D48(1-4):Bus(1-12):Dimmer(1-4)
GRAFIK Eye Dimmer-> Processor(1-16):Link(4-6):GRAFIK Eye(1-8):Output(1-8)

H48 Dimmer/Switch-> Processor(1-16):Link(4-6):Router H48(1-4):Bus(1-6):Dimmer(1-8)
RF Dimmer/Switch-> Processor(1-16):Link(8):Device type(1):Dimmer(1-64)

resourceSpecs.label: Search in Twitter with Track Filter

address.help: Words to match separated by spaces as: 'SomethingToSearch on Twitter'. Will be match if all of the terms in the address are present in a Tweet, regardless of order and ignoring case. Address must be between 1 and 60 bytes, inclusive.

resourceSpecs.help: DELETE HTTP request resource.
resourceSpecs.label: DELETE

address.help: Address Format = ENDPOINT;PAYLOAD where ENDPOINT and PAYLOAD are OPTIONAL. If PAYLOAD isn't specified, semi-colon is not neccesary. Eg: '/subpath;{"pay"="load"}', '/sub/path' , ';payload1=data1&payload2=data2'

resourceSpecs.help: GET HTTP request resource.
resourceSpecs.label: GET

address.help: Address Format = ENDPOINT;PAYLOAD where ENDPOINT and PAYLOAD are OPTIONAL. If PAYLOAD isn't specified, semi-colon is not neccesary. Eg: '/subpath;{"pay"="load"}', '/sub/path' , ';payload1=data1&payload2=data2'

resourceSpecs.help: POST HTTP request resource.
resourceSpecs.label: POST

address.help: Address Format = ENDPOINT;PAYLOAD where ENDPOINT and PAYLOAD are OPTIONAL. If PAYLOAD isn't specified, semi-colon is not neccesary. Eg: '/subpath;{"pay"="load"}', '/sub/path' , ';payload1=data1&payload2=data2'

resourceSpecs.help: PUT HTTP request resource.
resourceSpecs.label: PUT

address.help: Address Format = ENDPOINT;PAYLOAD where ENDPOINT and PAYLOAD are OPTIONAL. If PAYLOAD isn't specified, semi-colon is not neccesary. Eg: '/subpath;{"pay"="load"}', '/sub/path' , ';payload1=data1&payload2=data2'
